events.summary: Juan and Álvaro discuss the treasury situation — operating on a deficit but managing. Discussion turns to the Aragonese succession: with the Infantes disinherited, who are the heirs? Álvaro outlines the claimants. Juan notes his own legitimate claim to Aragon through his mother. Discussion of Bohemia and the Hussite Wars — four crusades have failed against them. The Council of Basel (1431) is convening to address church reform, Hussites, and papal authority. Juan decides to convene a theological council in Toledo to develop Castile's position before sending delegates to Basel.

exchanges.text: Who are the claimants to Aragon? I have my own claim too.
Álvaro outlines succession. Discussion of Bohemia, Hussites, Basel.
Summon a theological council in Toledo to discuss these matters.
Council summoned. Archbishop to issue requests.

events.summary: Álvaro presents four reports requiring Juan's attention, rolled on d100: (1) Roll 40 — Exaggerated indulgence preaching: some preachers falsely claiming crusade indulgences can save souls from purgatory, threatening theological legitimacy. (2) Roll 12 — A popular crusade ballad spreading through Castile, good for morale. (3) Roll 35 — Granadan executions: Muhammad IX executing suspected collaborators in desperation, showing regime instability. (4) Roll 78 — A Castilian officer considering leaving for Aragon's service. Juan issues guidance against false indulgence claims and allows officers to leave freely if not sworn.

exchanges.text: I rolled 40, 12, 35 and 78. Incorporate these in the story.
Four reports presented: false indulgences, crusade ballad, Granadan executions, officer leaving.
Issue guidance against false indulgence claims. Officers can leave freely.
Letters drafted. Juan and Álvaro discuss papal authority privately.
